THREDDS¶

Direct Download¶

You will learn how to download files through NCI’s THREDDS data server in this example. Click below for the notebook example.

Direct download notebook example

Data subsetting¶

The Netcdf Subset Service (NCSS) is one of the data service endpoints available on many of NCI’s hosted data collections. NCSS is currently available on NCI’s gridded datasets and allows users to request spatial and temporal queries using longitude and latitude values directly. In this example, you will use THREDDS web coverage service to request GeoTIFF data.

Data subsetting notebook example

Data viewing¶

You can have a quick view of the data using Godiva on THREDDS.

Data viewing notebook example

OPeNDAP¶

How to use OPeNDAP through NCI’s THREDDS data server

OPeNDAP notebook example

OGC WMS¶

How to use the Open Geospatial Consortium (OGC) Web Map Service (WMS) protocol through NCI’s THREDDS data server

OGC WMS notebook example

OGC WCS¶

You will learn how to constructing WCS GetCoverage requests, then verify requests with GDAL in Python

OGC WCS notebook example
